On 19 November, we signed a Memorandum of Understanding with Tricog Health, formalising our Take CaRe of Me partnership and reinforcing our commitment to patients in the cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic space. Made possible by our cross-functional working with Tricog, the integration of innovative new technologies into patient pathways seeks to support primary care physicians to more effectively identify early heart failure in type 2 diabetes patients, who may be at increased risk of associated cardio-renal complications**.  The relationship between type 2 diabetes and heart failure is one that is well established**, and yet awareness in emerging market countries remains limited*. By utilising AI analytics and advanced point-of-care diagnostic devices, Take CaRe of Me is generating data that highlights the increased susceptibility of patients, and could enable the early identification, prevention, and potential treatment of these comorbidities.It‚Äôs thanks to the pioneering efforts of an enormous team ‚Äìworking cross-functionally across multiple global territories‚Äì that this has been made possible. Congratulations to our colleagues and partners for this landmark moment in the CVRM field.* Atlas IDF 2019** Birkeland KI, et al. Diabetes Obes Metab. 2020;22(9):1607‚Äì1618

World Diabetes Day: recognising the need for change  On World Diabetes Day, I want to call attention to the global prevalence of type 2 diabetes, and highlight the health and economic burden that this places on countries worldwide. In many emerging market countries, millions of lives are affected by this disease*, with many type 2 diabetes patients going on to develop cardio-renal complications** ‚Äì complications that are preventable, and yet can be life threatening. At AstraZeneca, we believe in focusing on the entire patient ‚Äìand it‚Äôs for this reason that we‚Äôre integrating innovative new solutions into treatment pathways for patients with type 2 diabetes.  Our new, holistic approach will see us supporting healthcare practitioners in emerging market countries by introducing advanced technologies into the primary care setting, enabling the early diagnosis and treatment of cardio-renal complications. By raising risk awareness, we‚Äôre empowering patients to make informed decisions and be more involved in their own care. Check out the link below to learn more about World Diabetes Day: https://lnkd.in/dyG-ybz hashtag#WorldDiabetesDay hashtag#Type2Diabetes hashtag#AstraZeneca hashtag#WDD * Atlas IDF 2019** Birkeland KI, et al. Diabetes Obes Metab. 2020;22(9):1607‚Äì1618

World Diabetes Day: establishing new ways to provide effective treatment for type 2 diabetes patients  Ahead of World Diabetes Day, it‚Äôs important that we consider the challenges faced by type 2 diabetes patients, and the barriers that HCPs must overcome to provide effective care. In emerging market countries, a lack of awareness around the disease and shortage of resources may limit treatment options. At AstraZeneca, we recognise the need to address all aspects of a patient‚Äôs journey, and believe that treatment of the entire patient is the most effective route to wellness ‚Äì for type 2 diabetes, this means addressing cardio-renal complications (cardiovascular disease and chronic kidney disease) which can be life threatening. Through our new Take CaRe of Me programme, we‚Äôre embedding innovative technologies into the primary care setting in emerging markets, facilitating the early detection and identification of these complications and enabling early diagnosis and referral. This should give primary care physicians an opportunity to improve outcomes, and potentially save lives. hashtag#WorldDiabetesDay hashtag#Type2Diabetes hashtag#AstraZeneca hashtag#WDD
